content.question: A cylindrical resistor is connected to a battery with an <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>emf</mtext></mrow></math> of <math alttext="15.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in a current of <math alttext="3.0 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the circuit. The resistor is removed, and a new resistor of the same material with twice the radius and twice the length of the original resistor is connected to the battery. What is the new current in the circuit?
